> 
> OMG! It's a shuttle in a shuttle in another shuttle! SHUTTLE-ception!

Lol indeed

I just remembered that there is apparently something wrong with the Zarya Solar Panels included in the ISS Pack. Dragon used to tell us not to use them because they were buggy. They used to unleash the Kraken from my experience. So maybe take a look at them. The Mir Solar panels look just fine on the ISS. Actually all the solar panels that Bobcat did are actually astonishingly beautiful, considering when they were made. They are better than most Solar Panels released. Also just a friendly reminder please make sure all the textures are DDS please. Also if you are working on getting the Soyuz in game raidernicks launchers are beautiful as well. Although I still thinks bobcats soyuz spacecraft is still the best looking and functional, his launchers leave something to be desired. Raidernicks proton should be suitable for launching the Russian segments. I am glad raidernicks mods got saved and are being maintained. I mean when you are done with the ISS a few of his mods are gonna be important. He even made an Antares and Cygnus. [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125397-Historical-Rockets-Probes-and-Stations](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125397-Historical-Rockets-Probes-and-Stations)

Wait... your not making the shuttle smaller are you?? One of the things I liked about this shuttle is that it can take 2.5 meter parts

> 
> Wait... your not making the shuttle smaller are you?? One of the things I liked about this shuttle is that it can take 2.5 meter parts

The smaller of those two shuttles is the stock Kerbin sized shuttle, the larger is the resized to accommodate RSS/RO.

> 
> Wait... your not making the shuttle smaller are you?? One of the things I liked about this shuttle is that it can take 2.5 meter parts

nooo the opposite.

here you can see it takes the rescaled (larger Realism Overhaul) parts.

those parts I made I had to make a config, to make them RG compatible

nice. imagine how ksp will handle that model!

mod version is now 1.7.3.1... for those who want to use it in Realism overhaul I recommend the update.

if not then its not an importand update

both basic and full pack available.

iss work will be uploaded to the iss forum page. link on page one.

for now work done has been mainly on the truss sections (new and modified) and RO config for new parts.

I plan to make the whole section of truss rotate from where the launch clamps are holding.

standard ksp code DOES do it but not for the attached parts.

I will further investigate tomorrow.

anyway that's as far as I got for now.

no error codes...

anyone know what the issue was with the zarya panels were?

since you already use IR for the shuttle, wouldn't it be better to use IR to rotate the truss? but be aware that no docking port can be connected directly to a IR part

alternatively you could take the approach of the KOSMOS truss though
